FuncDef:
The login-user login-password command configures the user name and password on the master for the user to log in to a specified AP using the master.
The undo login-user command deletes the user name and password on the master for the user to log in to a specified AP using the master.
By default, no user name or password for the user to log in to a specified AP using the master is configured on the master.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the user name for the user to log in to a specified AP using the master.
The value is a string of 1 to 253 case-insensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the user password for the user to log in to a specified AP using the master.
The new password is at least eight characters long and contains at least two of the following types: upper-case letters, lower-case letters, digits, and special characters.
The password can be entered in either unencrypted or encrypted.
If a password is entered in unencrypted, the value is a string of 1 to 128 case-sensitive characters. When you input a password in simple text, the system displays the password in simple text mode, which brings risks.If a password is entered in ciphertext, the value is a string of 32 to 268 case-sensitive characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure the user name and password on the master for the user to log in to a specified AP using the master, run the login-user login-password command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
